intro: Antiphylla octandra, commonly known as the eight-angled antiphylla, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, opposite, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
